perturbation.original_text:
1. Term. Unless this Agreement is terminated earlier in accordance with the terms of Section ​12, the term of this Agreement shall commence
on the Effective Date and shall continue until July 31, 2019 (the “Initial Term”). Following the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew
for successive terms of six (6) months (each a “Renewal Term”, and together with the Initial Term, the “Term”) unless written notice is given by
either Party no later than thirty (30) days in advance of the expiration of the Initial Term or the applicable Renewal Term.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Term. Unless this Agreement is terminated earlier in accordance with the terms of Section ​12, the term of this Agreement shall commence
on the Effective Date and shall continue until July 31, 2019 (the “Initial Term”). Following the Initial Term, this Agreement may be renewed for successive terms of six (6) months (each a “Renewal Term”, and together with the Initial Term, the “Term”) upon mutual written agreement of both parties. Either Party may propose renewal terms no later than thirty (30) days in advance of the expiration of the Initial Term or the applicable Renewal Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies **automatic renewal** unless either party provides a written notice of non-renewal. The modified text changes the clause to state that renewal occurs **only upon mutual written agreement**. This contradicts the automatic renewal aspect of the original clause, creating uncertainty on whether the agreement renews automatically or requires active consent from both parties.

perturbation.original_text:
8.01. XSPA shall pay to Calm on a monthly basis an amount equal to (i) fifty percent (50%) of the Retail Price for all Products sold in the
Stores in the Territory during the applicable month minus (ii) fifty percent (50%) of any commission actually paid or payable to XSPA employee(s)
or contractor(s) attributable to sales of such Products during such month; provided that in no event shall such commission be greater than fifteen
percent (15%) of the Retail Price for the applicable Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.01. XSPA shall pay to Calm on a monthly basis an amount equal to (i) fifty percent (50%) of the Retail Price for all Products sold in the
Stores in the Territory during the applicable month minus (ii) fifty percent (50%) of any commission actually paid or payable to XSPA employee(s)
or contractor(s) attributable to sales of such Products during such month. The commission paid to XSPA employees shall be determined at the sole discretion of XSPA, without any limitations on the percentage of the Retail Price.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that commissions cannot exceed **15%** of the Retail Price. The modified clause states that the commission amount is determined at the **sole discretion of XSPA**, removing the limitation. This contradicts the first statement, making it unclear if the commission is capped or not.

perturbation.original_text:
10.06. EXCEPT WITH RESPECT TO EACH PARTY’S INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, (A) UNDER NO
CIRCUMSTANCE AND UNDER NO LEGAL THEORY (TORT, CONTRACT, OR OTHERWISE), SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE
OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS, LOSS OF OPPORTUNITY OR OTHER SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL
DAMAGES SUFFERED BY THE OTHER PARTY ARISING IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT; AND (B) THE MAXIMUM LIABILITY
OF EACH PARTY IN ANY WAY RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED $2,000,000.00 (EXCLUDING ANY AMOUNTS DUE AND
PAYABLE PURSUANT TO SECTION ​8 HEREUNDER).
perturbation.changed_text:
10.06. EXCEPT WITH RESPECT TO EACH PARTY’S INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, (A) UNDER NO
CIRCUMSTANCE AND UNDER NO LEGAL THEORY (TORT, CONTRACT, OR OTHERWISE), SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE
OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS, LOSS OF OPPORTUNITY OR OTHER SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL
DAMAGES SUFFERED BY THE OTHER PARTY ARISING IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT; provided, however, that this limitation shall not apply in cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct. (B) THE MAXIMUM LIABILITY
OF EACH PARTY IN ANY WAY RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED $2,000,000.00 (EXCLUDING ANY AMOUNTS DUE AND
PAYABLE PURSUANT TO SECTION ​8 HEREUNDER).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states there's no liability for consequential damages and sets a $2,000,000 liability cap. The modification introduces an exception: this damage limitation shall not apply in cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct. This creates an in-text contradiction as it is not explicitly stated what the liability will be if there is a case of gross negligence or willful misconduct.
